info.title: KeyHelp RESTful API
info.description:
Provides an interface to a server managed by the KeyHelp server administration tool. ### URL * To communicate with the API, you need to call a specific URL, which looks like the this:
``` https:///api/v1/ ``` * Have a look below to see all available API endoints. ### Authentication * You need to define API keys inside of the KeyHelp user interface (*Admin area* -> *Configuration* -> *API*).
Each API key should be restricted to certain IP / IP range. * Pass the API key with each request using the `X-API-Key` header field. ### Request format * Some requests require you to send data inside of the request body.
These data must be sent as **application/json**. ### Response format * Use the `ACCEPT` header field to specify your desired response mime type. * The following response formats are supported: - **application/json** (default) - **application/xml** - **text/yaml** ### Misc * The API is not enabled by default. You first have to turn it on via KeyHelp user interface.
(*Admin area* -> *Configuration* -> *API*) * You can decide, if you want to apply the password policy for the KeyHelp user interfacte also when using the API.
(*Admin area* -> *Configuration* -> *Password policy* -> *Apply password policy when using the API*)
### HTTP status code summary | Code | Description | | --- | --- | | **200 - OK** | Everything worked as expected. | | **201 - Created** | The ressource was successfully created. | | **204 - No Content** | The response does not contain any data. Used on delete operations. | | **400 - Bad Request** | The request was unacceptable, due to an malformed request, invalid parameter value or a missing required parameter. | | **401 - Unauthorized** | Invalid API key provided | | **403 - Forbidden** | API access is denied. | | **404 - Not Found** | The ressouce was not found / The requested endpoint was not found. | | **405 - Method Not Allowed** | The HTTP method for the requested endpoint is not allowed. | | **406 - Not Acceptable** | Invalid Accept header value. Mime type not supported. | | **5xx - Server error** | Something went wrong on KeyHelp's end. |

servers.description: The URL to your KeyHelp server API.

get.description:
Returns various server information.

If performance is a concern, you can use the query parameters,
to query only for the information you need.

Returns "pong".

Can be used to check API or server availability.

Returns a list of all client accounts on the server.

You can use the following sort parameter values to sort the results.
- id (default)
- username

post.description:
Creates a new client account.

To specify its account features, you should use a hosting plan,
otherwise it is created with the default hosting plan.
Use the hosting plan endpoint to gather the information you need.

If the following properties are empty / not set, they are auto-generated:
* password

If the following properties are auto-generated, they are part of the response:
* password

get.description: Returns account details of a single client determined by its ID.

delete.description: Deletes a client account and all associated resources.

get.summary: Listing all resources belonging to this client.
get.description:
Returns an object consisting of all resources belonging to the specified client ID.

Properties are:
* domains items
* certificates items
* emails items
* databases items
* ftp-users items

If performance is a concern, you can use the query parameters,
to query only for the information you need.

Returns the statistics of the client about its assigned resources and
their usage.
Returns information of a single client account specified by its username.

Returns a list of all hosting plans on the server.

You can use the following sort parameter values to sort the results.
- id (default)
- name
Returns the features of a single hosting plan specified by its ID.
Returns the features of a single hosting plan specified by its name.

Returns a list of all domains on this server.

You can use the following filter parameter values to filter the results.
- main_domains
- subdomains
- system_domains

You can use the following sort parameter values to sort the results.
- id (default)
- domain
- domain_utf8
Returns information of a single domain specified by its ID.
Returns information of a single domain specified by its domain name.

Returns a list of all certificates on the server.

You can use the following sort parameter values to sort the results.
- id (default)
- name
Returns information of a single certificate specified by its ID.

put.description:
Updates a certificate.

Specify only the fields, you want to update.

get.description: Returns information of a single certificate specified by its name.

Returns a list of all email accounts on the server.

You can use the following sort parameter values to sort the results.
- id (default)
- email
- email_utf8
Returns information of a single email account specified by its ID.
Returns information of a single email account specified by its email address.

Returns a list of all databases on the server.

You can use the following sort parameter values to sort the results.
- id (default)
- database_name
- database_username

post.summary: Creating a database and database user.
post.description:
Creates a new database.

If the following properties are empty / not set, they are auto-generated:
* database_name and database_username
* password

If the following properties are auto-generated, they are part of the response:
* database_name and database_username
* password

get.summary: Returning a single database and its database user.
get.description: Returns information of a database and its database user specified by its ID.

put.summary: Updating a database and its database user.

delete.summary: Deleting a database and its database user.
delete.description: Deletes a database and its database user.

get.summary: Returning a single database and its database user.
get.description: Returns information of a database and its database user specified by its database name.

Returns a list of all FTP users on the server.

You can use the following sort parameter values to sort the results.
- id (default)
- username

post.description:
Creates a new FTP user. **Please note**, to create a new FTP user, it is required that the corresponding (system) user account is fully set up. Otherwise you will receive the **400 Bad Request** error:
**Invalid property data for: 'uid', 'gid'** If the following properties are empty / not set, they are auto-generated: * username * password * home_directory (defaults to /www/) If the following properties are auto-generated, they are part of the response: * username * password

get.description: Returns information of a single FTP user specified by its ID.
Returns information of a FTP user specified by its username.

sort.name: sort
sort.description: The property you want to sort by.

order.name: order
order.description: The direction you want to sort.

hosting-plan-id.name: id
hosting-plan-id.description: Numeric ID of the hosting plan to get.

domains-system-domains.name: system-domains
domains-system-domains.description: Filters the result for system domains. It will not return any data, when main_domains and subdomains are set to false.

domain-name.name: name
domain-name.description: Domain in either UTF-8 or punycode variant.

ftp-user-id.name: id
ftp-user-id.description: Numeric ID of the FTP user to get.

example.message: API key is missing or invalid.

404-not-found.description: The specified resource was not found.

example.message: The specified resource was not found.

ip_addresses.description: The IP addresses associated to the server.

server_time.description: The time and timezone as ISO-8601 string.

api_docs.description: The URL where you view the appropriate API documentation.

label.description: The OS version in long form.

end_of_life.description: Indicates whether the OS has reached End-Of-Life status.

update_count.description: Indicates how many updates are available.

security_update_count.description: Indicates how many updates are security updates.

reboot_required.description: Indicates if a reboot is required in order to complete a previous update.

process_count.description: The number of processes the server has currently running.

emails_in_queue.description: The number of emails in the email queue.

minute_1.description: The load average of the last 1 minute.

minute_5.description: The load average of the last 5 minutes.

minute_15.description: The load average of the last 15 minutes.

percent.description: The load of the last 1 minute with taken the number of CPU cores in account.

level.description: A string expression of the "percent" value above.

disk_space.description: Disk space usage of the primary file system.

free.description: The amount of free disk space in byte.

used.description: The amount of used disk space in byte.

total.description: The total amount of disk space in byte.

percent.description: The disk space usage in percent.

inodes.description: Inode usage of the primary file system.

free.description: The amount of free memory in byte.

used.description: The amount of used memory in byte.

total.description: The total amount of memory in byte.

free.description: The amount of free swap space in byte.

used.description: The amount of used swap space in byte.

total.description: The total amount of swap space in byte.

percent.description: The swap space usage in percent.

domains.description: The number of main domains (including system domains).

scheduled_tasks.description: The number of scheduled tasks (cron jobs).

consumed_disk_space.description: The amount of consumed disk space by client accounts in byte.

traffic.description: The amount of traffic caused by client accounts in the current month in byte .

language.description: The language, either a two character code e.g. "de" or the more specific e.g. "de_DE"

email.description: The email address of the account.

notes.example: Any comments about this client account.

id_hosting_plan.description: The ID of the hosting plan when creating or updating a client.

created_at.description: The creation date of the user as ISO-8601 string.

is_suspended.description: The supsended status of the client.

suspend_on.description:
The date, when a user gets suspended.
The passed in value must be parse-able by the PHP function strtotime(). Best choice are ISO formats like "Y-m-d H:i:s", but "+30 days" are also possible.

delete_on.description:
The date, when a user gets deleted.
The passed in value must be parse-able by the PHP function strtotime(). Best choice are ISO formats like "Y-m-d H:i:s", but "+30 days" are also possible.

send_login_credentials.description: Determine, if new login credentials should be sent to the clients email address. Only takes affect when a new password was set / generated.

create_system_domain.description: Determine, if a system domain should be created. Only takes affect on creation of a new user.

skeleton.description:
The name of the skeleton directory which should get copied into the users www/ directory.
This property is marked as deprecated and should no longer being used.

client-stats.description: The value "-1" for the "max" property means "unlimited".

hosting-plan.description:
Representation of a hosting plan.

The value "-1" for resource properties means "unlimited".

id_user.description: The user ID of the domain. This field is required, when adding a new domain.

id_parent_domain.description:
The ID of the parent domain, or 0 when it is a main domain.
Needs to be specified when you want to create subdomains.

domain.description: The ASCII representation of the domain.

domain_utf8.description: The UTF-8 representation of the domain.

php_version.description: If empty, the domain uses the system php version. If set, the domain uses one of the installed additional php interpreters.

dkim_txt_record.example: default._domainkey IN TXT ( "v=DKIM1; k=rsa; s=email; " "...DKIM KEY..." )

create_www_subdomain.description: Only takes affect when creating a new user.

skeleton.description:
The name of the skeleton directory which should get copied into the users www/ directory.
Only works if the directory does not already exists.
This property is marked as deprecated and should no longer being used.

target.description:
Either a relative path to target folder (relative from clients /www/ folder), or an URL.
When specifing a URL, they have to start with "http://" or "https://."

id_certificate.description:
The certificate ID. You can only use either a certificate, the "lets_encrypt" option or none of both.
You can only assign certificates with at least "private_key" and "certificate" component'

lets_encrypt.description: Determin if the domain should use a Lets Encrypt certificate. You can only use either a certificate, the "lets_encrypt" option or none of both.

force_https.description: Force automatic forwarding to HTTPS when the domian is accessed via HTTP.

id_user.description: The ID of the associated client, or 0 if there is no client associated to the certificate.

valid_till.description: The date, when the certificate is no longer valid as ISO-8601 string.

issuer.example: AlphaSSL CA - SHA256 - G2 / GlobalSign nv-sa

id_user.description: The user ID of the email account. This field is required, when adding a new email account.

email.description: The ASCII representation of the email address.

email_utf8.description: The UTF-8 representation of the email address.

aliases.description: A list of all alias addresses in ASCII representation.

aliases_utf8.description: A list of all alias addresses in UTF-8 representation.

forwardings.description: A list of all forwarding addresses in ASCII representation.

forwardings_utf8.description: A list of all forwarding addresses in ASCII representation.

database.description: Representation of a database and the corresponding database user.

id_user.description: The user ID of the database. This field is required, when adding a new database.

description.example: This is the database for my Wordpress installation.

id_user.description: The user ID of the FTP user. This field is required, when adding a new FTP user.

description.example: This user can access my images.

home_directory.description: The home directory of the FTP user, beginning with either "/www/" or "/files".
